The original photo shows the H: 2A rocket taking off in Tanegashima, Japan, in May 2000, not the Apollo 8 launch. This discrepancy in the launch location and date raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
Snopes fact: checked a similar social media post in June and found a different image with the couple. The photo showed the pair standing before Viktor Vasnetsov’s painting "Ivan Tsarevich Riding the Grey Wolf" at the Tretyakov Gallery in Russia. This finding indicates that the image being shared on Facebook is not genuine.
The expert: s verdict also includes a comment from a user questioning the photo's authenticity, suggesting that others have doubts about its veracity as well. This skepticism further supports the notion that the claim is not authentic.
